> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pjYt4TN8,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-04-02T14:11:42.005+0000)

> Because it ignore the root problems with why these roles aren't being picked in team builder.

Well sometimes the root is very hard to fix,so you just put some band-aid on it instead.

And sometimes the root is very hard to fix, so you amputate the damaged limb. 

And sometimes the root is very hard to fix, but you go and fix it anyway because it needs to be done pronto.

And sometimes the root is very hard to fix, but the condition of the patient is stable so you take your time figuring out how to proceed.

-----
Riot treats the current Team Builder the last way, as their previous band-aids (icon/map update only on Team Builder) have done little to actually help.

Team Builder is a failed idea. It's not that the overarching thought behind it is bad. It is wonderful, IF people enjoyed playing each of the roles roughly the same amount. Now with the talk of a Ranked Team Builder I can't help but laugh. Riot had made the jungle unfun for the last 6-ish months (until recent patches) so a lot of people, myself included, walked away from the jungle. And the set up of supports is very similar to jungle in this; both the jungler and support have to play a TEAM game to win while each other lane/role tries to play hero/carry to win. 

Just like in World of Warcraft, some roles many people do not enjoy. So junglers/support (tanks healers in WoW) are played much less. Until Riot can change the feel of the roles, or the culture of the game, it will always be the "me first" damage players that cause people to not want to help/play the team game.

I actually think what they've described for ranked Team Builder will be better than what they've implemented for normal Team Builder.

Let's be honest, Team Builder is YOLO Builder. You pick one champion you want to play and you never look back. You can't look back! If you get matched with a team, see their picks and think "you know, this champ won't work so well with them, but this other champ would be awesome!", you can't change to make a better team. All you can do is stick with it or abandon them and home the matchmaking gods replace you with someone playing that champion. 

Their plans for ranked Team Builder is to just have you call a role and go from there. You can actually pick based on what your team is doing. You can see that your team needs a tank and your ADC picked Graves and go Leona. You can be a *team*. 

I've pretty much written off YOLO Builder for my own use. Between the adjusted match making (no, I'd rather not be in a mirror matchup with someone who's far better at the champ than me, thanks), the inflexible nature of picks, and the queue time, Riot pretty much has to bribe me to use it (see handing out shiny Summoner Icons, early access to the SR Update)
Is it better? Yes. But it doesn't fix the same issue that you have less people who enjoy playing support/jungle.

The last poll I saw suggested that there might be *more* support mains than any other type off mains. Granted, it was just a straw poll on the forums, but ADC was the least popular position at the time. If you've got newer info I'd defiantly be interested.

Lol, well let's be honest I'm not sure a stroll poll on the forums is really good to go from. But when logging into team builder as 3 or 4 man group, my ques are always higher when looking for a jungler/support over anything else.

Part of that is probably the fact that team builder is counter-intuitive for the support *role*.
I'd also like to think support mains are more likely to use the forums. But that's probably just idle musing.

Support, more than any other role, have to match the team.
If we have Sion top and Kog'maw ADC, I don't want Leona or Taric. I want Lulu or Janna.
If we have Quinn top and Kat mid, I don't want Soraka or Zyra. I want Thresh or Morgana.
If we have Cait ADC and Amumu jungle, I don't want Blitz or Sona. I want Xerath or Braum.

It's a lot easier to have a bad support for a team comp, since we tend to juggle a lot of different hats and don't get to play "solo-lane hero". That's also why it's a lot harder to main a specific support champion (not looking at you, "I do everything" Thresh).

-----------------------------------------

All that said. The role still has it's issues. Not the least of which is the fact that you're dependent on someone who [will probably] treat you like crap. You don't get boast worthy end-of-game stats (or any real measure of your value except heals). If you're team does well, they probably will forget you exist. If your team does poorly, it's probably your fault (and jungler's).
If your lane does poorly, it ***is*** your fault. The 0/53/1 ADC has nothing to do with it, since you stole their 1 kill and 12 CS (with Targon).

Which comes back to there being a problem with team builder. 

When you do normals, sit back and fill. Count who calls what role. That will be more representative than team builder.

I got a better proposal OP:
**
Give extra IP gains when there's a role lacking (say support and jungle at the moment) on the team builder servers. The system will inform you of which roles will give you more gains before choosing the role.**

This makes it so that if for some reason mages become the rarest thing, mages get the most bonus IP. etc.
